page.title: 08INDUSTRY IN FLITWICK.
page.content: Industry met local needs until the village began to expand in the 1950's. As more people came to live here and the{M1 motorway}was built nearby a large{glass factory}was located in the town. A by-pass has improved road communication and an industrial estate is being developed. A railway siding exists but is little used. Flitwick has two{furniture factories which have grown from small companies to sell their products nationally. Smaller factories exist which supply the goods and services the large companies need such as boxes for packing, pallets for storage and handling and transport facilities. A large{distribution centre}run by a road haulage company uses our proximity to the M1 and Flitwick's mid-way position between London and the Midlands.
